definition: to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
to make good a deficit/to reverse a loss
to turn one's head/to turn around
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
crooked/not straight/staggering from side to side
crooked/not straight/staggering from side to side
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered

sentences.english: He sprained (strained, wrenched) his ankle by a fall.
sentences.chinese: 他摔了一跤扭了脚脖子。

sentences.english: Twist off cap, remove quality seal.
sentences.chinese: 打开盖扭，撕掉瓶口密封。

sentences.english: Landmine ? Want to do the hip twist ?
At work, at paying out a cable or winding up a capstan, Jean Valjean was worth four men.
sentences.chinese: 服劳役时，扭铁索，推绞盘，冉阿让抵得上四个人。

sentences.english: I rolled my ankle in a football practice.
sentences.chinese: 我练习美式足球的时候扭到脚踝了。

sentences.english: I carried a heavy piece of luggage a week ago, I Think maybe I twisted my back at that time.
sentences.chinese: 一个星期前，我提了件重行李，我想可能那时扭的腰。

sentences.english: The bone in his leg had not been properly set.
sentences.chinese: 他腿骨扭了还没有整好。

sentences.english: After the guarantee welding the connection position does not appear crooked.
sentences.chinese: 保证焊接后接驳位不出现歪扭。

sentences.english: Nahti walked toward the bed, and Marcus jumped toward the door, struggling with the doorknob.
sentences.chinese: 娜蒂向床走去，马库斯则向门跳去，奋力的扭门把手。

sentences.english: Methods Hotplate and writhing test in mice were applied.
sentences.chinese: 方法小鼠扭体法及热板法。

sentences.english: Hertzog's mouth formed a soft but twisted smile .
sentences.chinese: 赫佐格的嘴形成了一个浅浅的，但是歪扭的微笑。

sentences.english: It came out as more of a grimace.
sentences.chinese: 它出来如一个面部的歪扭更多。

sentences.english: The horn is OK appreciably ground is twisted upcountry, should inspect try audition effect actually to decide.
sentences.chinese: 喇叭可以略微地向内扭，要视实际试听的效果来决定。

sentences.english: But she looked away. Out the window, at the driveway.
sentences.chinese: 但她把脸扭了过去，朝窗外车道看去。

sentences.english: Creep up to a sleeping mamba , tweak it by the tail. Crikey!
sentences.chinese: 他会蹑手蹑脚的走向一条熟睡的大王蛇，扭它的尾巴。

sentences.english: Suddenly the Arab took out a knife, pressed a button and began to stab Glue.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人突然抽出刀，按动按扭，朝格鲁直刺过去。

definition: to sway one's hips/to twist one's waist
to protrude/to stick out/to pout (also written 噘)/to embarrass (people)
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
